title: Horton Bank Country Park Walking Route

images.caption: Former Horton Bank reservoir, now country park

images.title: Paul Glazzard / Horton Bank Country Park
images.caption: Park in the former reservoir at Horton Bank Top, south of Clayton.

images.title: Paul Glazzard / Horton Bank Country Park
images.caption: A family and their dog make their way along the lakeside trail.

images.title: Tim Green / Horton Bank Country Park
images.caption: Nice view over the lake.

description: This pretty country park in Bradford has some well laid out walking trails to try. In the park there's a picturesque lake with waterside footpaths and lots of wildlife to see. There are some hills in the park which you can climb for some wonderful views over the surrounding dales countryside and the city of Bradford. You can extend the walk by heading south west and picking up the Bronte Way. The long distance trails could be used to link up with the Calderdale Way to explore the Shibden Valley and the popular Shibden Park near Halifax .

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The park is a nice place to bring your dog for a walk so you'll probably see other owners on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head a few miles west and there's more nice lakeside trails to be found around Ogden Water on the Pennine Moors. A few miles to the north is the popular Shipley Glen with its old tramway, museum and woodland trails to try. Near here you'll also find Chellow Dene Reservoir.

display_address: Great Horton Road, Westwood Park, Bradford, West Yorkshire, England, BD7 4PL, United Kingdom
